intro: Lampranthus stanfordiae, commonly known as the red-hot poker or fireplant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. It produces vibrant, showy blooms during the summer months, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. Lampranthus stanfordiae is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
